Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Stats: Community Packages shows non-Community Packages #2" (#8456) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Describe the bug

The Community Packages shows non-Community Packages, see screenshot



url: https://www.nuget.org/stats/packages

### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. go to https://www.nuget.org/stats/packages


### Expected behavior
Not showing Microsoft packages when "Show all packages" isn't checked. Currently 3 microsoft.* packages are shown

### Screenshots

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5808377/111561543-e9a8de80-8794-11eb-9d5c-0a7e3b9e43b6.png)



related: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7314

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed pull request "Revert "Fix 3107 - Gallery UTs take a long time to finish."" (#3880) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened issue "[Feature Request] Private feeds locked by an ApiKey" (#8455) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Current NuGet gallery is for public consumption - it's like a single, PUBLIC feed. 

Would love to have a the ability to create private feeds, locked by api keys (which already exist).

Currently we could:
- Use one of the -other- nuget server implementations that exist but this means we need to manage them (which most people don't need to want to manage anything, these days)
- Use a commercial product. This is good for businesses that making a profit/want extra security+complience/advanced features/etc ... but there's still a section of the community that don't need all of that and/or don't make money (but still would like private feeds).

So it would be really awesome if this could be a feature that could be considered.


(This idea was raised in #8314 )

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Recover my old account" (#8452) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Hello,
I've a problem recovering my old account, it has been year I didn't published any package now I want to reuse my old nuget account because I'm "back in business"

The pr0oblem is that if I login with the old account using user and password it says I can't
So I used my microsoft account to register but I want to reuse my old account, how can I do that?

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Remove deprecated field "owners" from VS UI" (#10666) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

Even if the field "owners" in the `.nuspec` file has been deprecated, the NuGet UI in Visual Studio shows this field when the `nuspec` is created from the `csproj` and consumed directly in VS.

Visual Studio version: 16.10.0 Preview 1

## Repro steps and/or sample project

1. Create a C# .NET 5 project with the following nuget attributes:
```
<PropertyGroup>
        <GeneratePackageOnBuild>true</GeneratePackageOnBuild>
        <GenerateNuspecDependsOn>$(GenerateNuspecDependsOn);SetPackageVersion</GenerateNuspecDependsOn>
        <PackageOutputPath>..\nuget</PackageOutputPath>

        <PackageId>MyComponent</PackageId>
        <Version>1.0.0</Version>
        <Authors>Raffaele Rialdi</Authors>
        <Company>Raf</Company>
        <PackageTags>.NET </PackageTags>
        <Description>Abcdef</Description>
</PropertyGroup>

```
2.  Publish the library / package in a local folder
3.  Reference the package from another project. The UI in VS shows the `owners` field:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5183152/111519167-1a6a2300-8757-11eb-9b13-90aaded7f0d4.png)

The `owners` field is not shown when browsing the public nuget website.

/cc @anangaur

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Spurious NU5128 warning related to content in runtimes folder" (#10665) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | Visual Studio | MSBuild.exe | dotnet.exe):

> Microsoft (R) Build Engine version 16.9.0+57a23d249 for .NET Framework
> .NET SDK 5.0.201 a09bd5c86c

## Repro steps and/or sample project

1. Clone https://github.com/rseanhall/Core.Native/tree/nu5128-bug
2. Run appveyor.cmd

Observe no warnings or errors.

3. Reset to the previous commit (https://github.com/rseanhall/Core.Native/commit/4e3c12a45cb91828ac94963129495033a4402136).
4. Run appveyor.cmd

Observe the NU5128 warning.

5. Reset back 5 more commits (https://github.com/rseanhall/Core.Native/commit/8296f237c69743d3e6cbdc58fc07e8470562b92e).
6. Run appveyor.cmd

Observe no warnings or errors.

### Summary

We are packing a .nupkg through an SDK-style .csproj. This has native assets that require us to author the .nuspec ourselves. The native assets are properly put into the runtimes folder. If those files are moved under the lib/netstandard2.0 folder, then there is no warnings but the package is broken because they belong in the runtimes folder.

### Verbose Logs

```
Build succeeded.

"C:\src\mynewwix4\Core.Native\src\WixToolset.Core.Native\WixToolset.Core.Native.csproj" (Pack target) (1) ->
(GenerateNuspec target) ->
  C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\5.0.201\Sdks\NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack\build\NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack.targets(221,5): warning
NU5128: Some target frameworks declared in the dependencies group of the nuspec and the lib/ref folder do not have exac
t matches in the other location. Consult the list of actions below: [C:\src\mynewwix4\Core.Native\src\WixToolset.Core.N
ative\WixToolset.Core.Native.csproj]
C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\5.0.201\Sdks\NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack\build\NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack.targets(221,5): warning NU
5128: - Add lib or ref assemblies for the netstandard2.0 target framework [C:\src\mynewwix4\Core.Native\src\WixToolset.
Core.Native\WixToolset.Core.Native.csproj]

    1 Warning(s)
    0 Error(s)
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Custom V2 OData queries will be deprecated March 9th, 2021 " (#54) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
We announced the deprecation of custom V2 OData queries (#37) last year and conducted a dry run of the deprecation to ensure that there are no surprises for users (#40). 

We will begin blocking endpoints used by 3rd party clients in March 9, 2021, as detailed in [the blogpost here](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/custom-v2-odata-queries-will-be-deprecated-march-9-2021/).

Please let us know about your questions or concerns on [this discussion post.](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7423)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "The NuGet.org repository signing certificate will be updated as soon as March 15th, 2021" (#53) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
The current NuGet.org repository signing certificate will be updated as soon as March 15th, 2021. If you validate that packages are repository signed by NuGet.org using a [NuGet client policy](https://docs.microsoft.com/nuget/consume-packages/installing-signed-packages), the [`NuGet.exe verify`](https://docs.microsoft.com/nuget/reference/cli-reference/cli-ref-verify) command, or the [`dotnet nuget verify`](https://docs.microsoft.com/dotnet/core/tools/dotnet-nuget-verify) command, you will need to take steps by March 15th, 2021 to avoid disruptions when installing packages from NuGet.org signed with the new certificate. 

If you are unsure if you will be impacted or want to see instructions to allow the new certificate, please see our blogpost on the matter: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/the-nuget-org-repository-signing-certificate-will-be-updated-as-soon-as-march-15th-2021/

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Still have NuGet Restore Issues on Debian 10" (#51) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
The isssue seems to be marked as resolved #49 but i'm still facing the same issue on Debian 10.
```

/builds/company/modules/myproject/myproject.Tests/myproject.Tests.csproj : error NU3028: Package 'Microsoft.IdentityModel.Logging 5.6.0' from source 'https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json': The author primary signature's timestamp found a chain building issue: UntrustedRoot: self signed certificate in certificate chain
/builds/company/modules/myproject/myproject/myproject.csproj : error NU3028: Package 'System.Security.Principal.Windows 4.5.0' from source 'https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json': The author primary signature's timestamp found a chain building issue: UntrustedRoot: self signed certificate in certificate chain 
.......
```

ID=debian
